reasoning: IWM thesis hinges on Supreme Court tariff ruling Feb 20 (70% probability of strike-down). Russell 2000 small-caps already up 8% YTD and are least tariff-exposed name in our playbook. CPI at 2.4% supports rate cut narrative and floating-rate debt holders. Execute modest hedge position ($255 = 1.5 shares at $170) to build exposure that benefits if tariffs struck down (broad market relief) or if they're upheld (small-caps rallied for rate cut hope). This trade is the purest play on tariff ruling outcome. Conservative sizing (1.5 shares) limits downside if small-caps retest lows.

CSCO thesis is credible (attractive 18.5x forward P/E post-selloff, AI infrastructure orders $2.1B, analyst support maintained) but execution timing is wrong. Current environment is too volatile pre-tariff ruling Feb 20; CSCO's 12% pullback to $77-79 may extend further if market reprices chip stocks broadly. Wait for: (1) stabilization above $75 support for 2+ sessions, (2) post-Supreme Court ruling clarity on tariff impact on networking infrastructure, (3) technical confirmation of reversal. Thesis is still valid but patience is prudent. Hold dry powder for Feb 20-21 entry opportunity.

ABNB at ~$121 provides critical non-AI, non-semiconductor diversification to our dangerously concentrated portfolio. 24% upside to $148 PT, recent analyst upgrades, $1.1B buyback support, and Q1 guidance beat validate thesis. Execute modest position ($75 = 0.6 shares at $125) to rebalance away from 6-of-8 semiconductor exposure. Travel/consumer name is uncorrelated with tariff ruling and AI sentiment rotation risks. Confidence 0.65 reflects higher multiple expansion risk in consumer discretionary if rates don't fall as expected, but diversification imperative overrides.

ANET thesis confirmed with strong Q4 beat and Q1 guidance crush. Goldman PT $188 (23% upside) provides favorable risk/reward. AI networking infrastructure demand is secular and less tariff-sensitive than other semiconductors. Entry at current ~$152 is reasonable; execute modest position ($650 = 4.3 shares at $152) to diversify out of pure-play chip names. This is a lower-volatility AI infrastructure play less exposed to Supreme Court tariff ruling uncertainty. Confidence in execution is high given recent earnings confirmation.

Adding now risks catching a tariff-driven pullback; better to wait for post-ruling stabilization or earnings dip below $175 as outlined in thesis. Portfolio concentration already extreme (6 of 8 holdings semiconductor/AI-exposed). Preserve $979.53 buying power for Feb 20 volatility and post-ruling opportunities.

This is a tactical diversification from semiconductor heaviness. Playbook suggests buy on pullback to $260-265; current conditions may offer entry. Deploy $60 of remaining cash for 0.30 shares at ~$200/share (conservative estimate) — this is a small-cap hedge bet on tariff ruling going in market's favor. Less correlated to NVDA/earnings risk.

However, playbook requires stabilization above $75 for 2 sessions before entry. Current market conditions (binary event risk, semiconductor sector stall narrative) make it prudent to wait for confirmation. Do NOT buy into broad selloff until tariff ruling is clear. Reserve for post-Feb-20 entry if conditions stabilize and technicals confirm support hold.
